bibl.title: Letter from Frank Carey to Philip Showalter Hench, June 9, 1950

div1.p: Carey sends Hench copies of two Associated Press stories on Walter Reed and yellow fever that he has written. He discusses the interviews and research he has done for the stories, requests a photograph of Building No. 1, and expresses hope that the second article, which discusses preservation of the building, will help to generate support for that effort.

div1.head: Letter from Frank Carey to Philip Showalter Hench, June 9, 1950
div1.opener:
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
330 STAR BUILDING
WASHINGTON 4, D. C.
JUNE 9, 1950
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH,
ROCHESTER, MINN.
DEAR DOCTOR HENCH:
div1.p: THANKS VERY MUCH FOR YOUR GOOD LETTER.

ENCLOSED ARE COPIES OF TWO STORIES I HAVE WRITTEN. THE
LONGER ONE IS DESIGNED FOR USE ON JUNE 25, THE GOLDEN ANNIVERSARY OF
REED'S ARRIVAL IN CUBA FOR THE YELLOW FEVER WORK.

THE SECOND STORY IS DESIGNED AS A “FOLLOW UP,” POSSIBLY
FOR USE ON JUNE 26.

I DID NOT WANT TO INCLUDE THE BUILDING-PRESERVATION
ANGLE IN THE FIRST ARTICLE, WHICH IS QUITE LONG ALREADY AND MAY HAVE TO
BE CUT. ALSO, A SEPARATE STORY ON THE BUILDING ANGLE MIGHT POSSIBLY
LEAD TO SOME SUPPORT FOR YOUR HOPES IN THAT REGARD. I CERTAINLY HOPE SO.

I HAVE TAKEN THE LIBERTY OF QUOTING FROM YOUR LETTER, AND
I THINK YOU WILL AGREE THAT IT IS NECESSARY THAT YOU BE QUOTED.

I'M LEAVING TODAY TO BE AWAY FROM THE OFFICE FOR THREE
WEEKS ON VACATION, SO I'D APPRECIATE IT IF YOU WOULD RETURN BOTH STORIES
TO MR. HERMAN ALLEN, ASSOCIATED PRESS NEWSFEATURES EDITOR, AT THE
ABOVE ADDRESS AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

WE'D VERY MUCH APPRECIATE GETTING A GOOD PRINT OF
“BUILDING NO. 1”--THE SOONER THE BETTER IN ORDER TO HAVE IT PUBLISHED
WITH THE STORY--AND PLEASE LET MR. ALLEN KNOW ABOUT ANY EXPENSE INVOLVED.
WE HAVE ASKED OUR NEW YORK OFFICE TO TRY TO GET SOME MORE MATERIAL
FROM THE BETTMANN ARCHIVES, AND OUR HAVANA CORRESPONDENT GOT A NEW
PICTURE OF JOHNNY MORAN. WE INTERVIEWED JOHNNY, DR. COOKE AND MR. HANBERRY
IN CONNECTION WITH THE STORY.

I'VE GOTTEN A BIG KICK OUT OF DOING RESEARCH ON THE
JOB, AND I CAN APPRECIATE YOUR ZEAL. YOUR OWN ARTICLES WERE SWELL.

I'VE READ KELLY, TRUBY, MUCH OF A BOOK ABOUT CARROLL,
THE COMPILATION OF PAPERS AND RECORDS ISSUED AS A SENATE DOCUMENT, AND
VARIOUS OTHER WRITINGS ON THE SUBJECT. I'VE ALSO HAD TWO GRAND TALKS
WITH GENERAL KEAN, IN WHOM YOU HAVE A GREAT ADMIRER.

HOPE YOU CAN READ THE LONGER STORY WHICH IS A
CARBON OF THE ORIGINAL TURNED OVER TO THE DESK.

GOOD LUCK TO YOU, AND THANKS AGAIN FOR YOUR LETTER AND
FOR THE REPRINTS.
div1.closer:
SINCERELY YOURS, FRANK CAREY,
SCIENCE REPORTER
P.S. WE'D NEED A 5 X 7 OR AN 8 X 9 PRINT. THANKS.
FEC
